chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to the probation ordered in Count 2.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Pay the DNA surcharges, costs, and disbursements as ordered.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.  Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, Court ordered monies to be taken by the Department of Corrections from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to then be paid while on Extended Supervision.
Court set restitution at zero, as none has been requested.

Obtain GED.
Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with  Valayshia C., her residence or workplace.
No contact with Scott H.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs; take as prescribed and for only as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary.
No alcohol.

Undergo a mental health evaluation; follow any treatment recommended.
Anger management counseling.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.

AODA assessment, treatment if needed.
Urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With release to the Day Reporting Center; good time allowed.

miscConds.notes:
The Court advised defendant that as to Count 2, he is a convicted felon not and that he may not possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility. 
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not previously taken.

timeConds.notes: With release to the Day Reporting Center; good time allowed.

records.addlTxt:
INVOICE #
FORWARDED TO ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT, IN THE AMOUNT OF $625.00 to Dr.Pankiewicz for services on 03-02-15, 03-03-15, 03-04-15, 03-05-15.
COPY IN FILE.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Louis J Johnson not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard  for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial. Case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as to Count 2, he is a convicted felon not and that he may not possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 on 5/12/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Louis J Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Louis J Johnson in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant is now charged as follows:
COUNT 01:
Resisting/Obstructing an Officer,  a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 946.41(1).
COUNT 02:
Burglary (same charge as on Information).
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 20.

Defendant Louis J Johnson in court (bull pen) with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Louis J Johnson in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense  was in Judge Konkol's court the entire morning requesting an adjournment.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.

Defendant Louis J Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Louis J Johnson in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are in receipt of doctor's report; defense counsel advised the court that they will not proceed with the NGI plea and request a plea date.  Court ordered case adjourned before Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court by telephone, defendant Malik A Jenkins not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel is in trial and requests an adjourned Doctor's Report Return date.  No objection from the state. Case adjourned to Branch 20.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
/from Dr. Pankiewicz, received and filed.

/for Examination Under 971.16, signed and filed.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.

Defendant Louis J Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Louis J Johnson in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease defect.   Court appoints Dr. John Pankiewicz as requested by the parties and ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report before Branch 20.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Louis J Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Louis J Johnson in custody.  Sarah Schroeder for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Greg Grenisse   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy.  Defense does not enter a plea at this time.  Defense may enter a special plea on the next court date.   Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Arraignment scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Louis J Johnson in court with attorney Eric Vega for Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Louis J Johnson in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney is not available, motion hearing in another court. State's witnesses were present for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION including DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LUDIE C. AND VALAYSHIA C.; AND THEIR RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
